basics.name: Mengying Lin
basics.label: MS Robotics @ Georgia Institute of Technology

work.name: Robot Learning and Reasoning Lab, Georgia Institute of Technology
work.summary: Developed a part-level graph correspondence framework that enables zero-shot manipulation transfer across unseen object categories. Designed multi-scale object representations and an optimal-transportâ€“based matching algorithm to propagate grasps and trajectories directly from geometric structure. Integrated the method with MimicGen to generate diverse demonstrations and validated its effectiveness through simulation and real-world execution on a Franka Panda robot.

work.name: Institute for AI Industry Research, Tsinghua University
work.summary: Developed a task-aware neural field system that enabled more accurate scene understanding and supported robust multi-modal localization and navigation. Designed a selective experience replay strategy to prioritize task-relevant, high-confidence features, effectively reducing semantic noise during continual learning. The resulting system achieved a +4.36 improvement in localization accuracy over the previous state of the art, significantly enhancing downstream navigation reliability.

work.name: Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences
work.summary: Developed a plug-and-train module that dynamically balances LLM-derived general priors with dataset-specific priors to improve downstream policy learning. The approach achieved state-of-the-art performance in both seen and unseen environments in the AI2-THOR simulator and successfully transferred navigation policies to physical robots in a zero-shot setting, demonstrating reliable real-world task completion. (IROS 2025 oral.)

education.institution: University of Chinese Academy of Sciences
